name: The Talbott Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Talbott Hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is very elegant and traditional but not for those looking for a cool edgy hotel. The ambience of the hotel is in keeping with the refinement of the area. The staff are extremely warm and helpful and are very willing to provide advice. The red line on the subway (use this to get out to the baseball or to the Loop) is a few blocks away and you are 2 blocks from
reviews.title: Personal service in refined location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Magnificent Mile and the John Hancock building. A run along the beach is easy from the hotel and a magical way to start the day. The hotel restaurant was good for breakfast and dinner but there are many other local options as well. If you are planning a picnic during your stay check out Potash which is a supermarket/deli round the corner from the hotel. Those with a sweet tooth should visit the great cupcake shop opposite the Talbott. The Museum of Contemporary Art is a short walk away and is a must see.
reviews.title: Boutique, but not luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the same price, I've stayed in a London boutique hotel that offered far more amenities. No slippers, stingy on toiletries, and in order to have adequate light, we had to go out and buy newer, brighter bulbs for the lamps. The carpet was dingy and stained, and with the exception of the bed, the furniture upholstery had seen better days. The restaurant breakfast food was just adequate and the bartender in the evening looked at us like we were low rent, for requesting a Guinness and a German variety of beer. What gives? Very odd for a hotel that bills itself as a member of "small luxury hotels of the world". In fairness, the concierges, car services, maid service, were all first rate.
reviews.title: Talbott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: The Talbott is squeezed in among the high rise luxury hotels surrounding it, cutting out the light and views from all but a very few rooms. You would think they would compensate with other niceties. I found this very puzzling? For Chicago, the Talbott is in an absolutely ideal location and it costs less than its high-flying hotel neighbors. It also allows dogs. There were some mighty cute ones! But the food and drink offerings in the hotel, and the shabbiness of the room left us disappointed. Too bad.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location on the magnificent milrinone chicago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable, small rooms, great location for shopping. Decor is business conservative. Avoid rooms on W side that face brick wall. Rooms well appointed but not luxurious. Small restaurant in lobby is convenient w good food.
reviews.title: Excellent centre hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights and enjoyed everything about the Hotel. The room was beautiful and the service was outstanding. Kudos to the folks manning the concierge desk who were very helpful.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel in a Great City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I would love to know where they found their pillows?? These were the most comfortable pillows I have ever slept on. I wish I could have brought them home.
reviews.title: Friendly and Welcoming Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Talbott Hotel was the company choice. A boutique style hotel in the heart of the Chicago's Miracle Mile. Upon arrival, I was upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. My gosh, it was as big as many metro city apartments. It was great; beautiful bathroom, comfortable bed and pillows. The staff were friendly and truly made me feel welcome. I was also given a breakfast voucher for the restaurant downstairs. It was all good and sorry I was only there for one night. I recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Great location & Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights for a biz trip. This hotel is located in Chicago downtown. I enjoy the convenience of the location. The staff is super friendly and the room is clean & cozy.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The valet parking is $58, if you want to save $18 dollars you can park at the garage across the street.
reviews.title: Charles the doorman

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If, like me, you spend a long time reseaching where to stay before finally booking then I can save you some time and say just book The Talbott. The experience is top class from start to finish. We arrived early and had no problem checking in, even getting a welcome upgrade for our five day visit.
reviews.title: Fabuous - Just book it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are decorated stylishly and very well maintained. The in-room computer is a welcome addition to the standard room spec at other hotels. The beds are super-comfortable and Molton Brown products in the bathroom all add to the feeling of effortless luxury.
reviews.title: Gem of a hotel in Chicago's Gold Coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: I have to say that the hotel staff deserve particular note as they walked the fine line between friendliness and politeness effortlessly. Every single person we encountered seemed genuinely happy in their work and welcoming to both the hotel and Chicago.
reviews.title: Beautiful room, great location and amazing service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I'm usually awful at writing up my own experiences on here but I seriously couldn't let such a great hotel experience go by without praise.
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a magnificent hotel right off the Magnificent Mile. The entire staff was extremely courteous, friendly and down-to-earth. Our room was very quiet (even though right downtown) and was extremely spacious. I loved the extra touches provided by the hotel, from nightly turndown service to the free wi-fi. And a 5-10 minute walk to great shopping and entertainment on Rush St. and Michigan Ave. I am already looking forward to coming back! If you love boutique hotels and exceptional service, The Talbott Hotel is not to be missed.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Talbott Hotel was an exceptional experience. For business or personal stay, the location is ideal, service was exceptional (from front desk staff to housekeeping) and the rooms were spacious and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Wonderful boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: I would stay here again in a heart beat!
reviews.title: Too Notch hotel in the heart of Chucago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the Talbott Hotel on the website of the Small Luxury Hotels of the world.It did not disappoint us as it was such a quant luxurious hotel in the heart of Chicago. The check in was very efficient and fast and all the staff were always very friendly, respectful and helpful.We ate a few nights at the hotels restaurant which was great. We had good sleeps as the beds were very comfortable and we were very impressed at the old fashioned turn down service that still exists there with delicious chocolates on the pillows.
reviews.title: Best location with personal touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: A special thank you goes to Dwayne, one of the extremely friendly bell boys. He was so helpful and gave us lots of good information about Chicago.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great service, wonderful room and all for a reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely return to The Talbott Hotel as I felt that I was very spoilt and I enjoyed the experience.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience

description: Discover the many comforting rewards of a small European style hotel in the heart of Chicago's Gold Coast. Steps away from Michigan Avenue. As staff well versed in the art of fine European hospitality, people who remember your name and tend swiftly to your special, as well as, everyday needs. A host of gracious amenities including nightly turn-down service, morning newspapers, complimentary high-speed wireless Internet access, and complimentary access to a world class health center. Little Market Brasserie, a restaurant from Chef Ryan Poli, Mercadito Hospitality and the Tippling Bros. located in the lobby, brings a fresh approach to classic french brasseries by merging tastes from regions around the United States, with ingredients from around the world.
